p: The IC 50 and IC 90 values of condensed tannin-enriched extract on egg hatchability and larval development inhibition is shown in Tables 4 and 5. Accordingly, the highest IC 50 and IC 90 values for egg hatchability and larval development inhibition were recorded with A. gumifera followed by S. guineensa whereas the lowest value was recorded with R. glutinosa. Hence, the condensed tannin inhibiting egg hatching and larval development most potently was R. glutinosa followed in descending order of activity by S. guineensa and A. gumifera. This result suggests that all three condensed tannin-enriched extracts exhibited variation in potency to inhibit the egg hatchability and larval development.
